study.name: Wellington Digital Twin
study.Description: Create a dynamic realtime model that presents information in a non-linear and engaging way, bringing together visualization, sensors, geospatial and infrastructure across government and nongovernmental organizations with the aim of helping making better decisions and understanding climate change and economic development, as well as enhancing public engagement.
study.3D Platform Features: View Analysis, Displaying Transportation Statistics, Displaying Car Park Availability
study.Decision Making: Real-time data processing for instant report such as car park availability; Real-time tracking of cycling traffic for control and regulation
study.Contested Claims/Challenges: Low engagement among citizens; Become a game city that citizens will be players, can even play in augmented reality; The Wellington Underground Asset Map (WUAM) programme that will create a digital twin of the infrastructure under the cityâ€™s streets.
